page.title: 17Peoples memories of Fetcham
page.content: (continued from page 16) Of the people interviewed, one remembered the pound, a stables next to the blacksmiths and the Cock Inn. Only one person had a car _ he also had a chauffeur. The squire lived in Badingham House and the Parson and his wife ran the school (St. Mary's School). One person remembered seeing Silent Films in Leatherhead. On Empire Day every child in the school received 1/_ from a large landowner who worked for the bank of England. One man earned three pounds a week in his first job. A woman earned only one pound five shillings. A lady teacher earned nine pounds a month.
